intro: Turraea leonensis, commonly known as the African yellowwood, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by woody, three-lobed capsules. Turraea leonensis is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along riverbanks. It is valued for its durable wood and has traditional uses in various cultures.
